channel.title: Password Problem
channel.description: all the character files passwords are a bunch of numbers like this how do i fix it to the real password? [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/fxgu3l.jpg[/img]

item.title: Password Problem
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

JavaLearner:

Trust me, don’t do this if you’re planning on hosting a game. If something happens, they got everyone’s password… If you seriously want to access an account with an encrypted password, make a new account with a password you know and go in to that file and copy/paste the password from that account and save and you’ll be able to log in on that account.

The first part of your statement is true; if someone gains access to your files without an encryption, they will have passwords.
The second part is untrue; copying and pasting a literal password into the character file will cause the game to read the password as the actual encrypted password, causing a block on login.

Read full topic

item.title: Password Problem
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Remove Misc.basicEncrypt in the PlayerSave class.

			characterfile.write("character-password = ", 0, 21);
			//p.playerPass = Misc.basicEncrypt(p.playerPass);
			characterfile.write((p.playerPass), 0, (p.playerPass).length());
			//characterfile.write(Misc.basicEncrypt(p.playerPass).toString(), 0, Misc.basicEncrypt(p.playerPass).toString().length());
			characterfile.newLine();

As a result of this, all character files need to have their password line deleted because it will try to read the encrypted password as a normal password.

Read full topic
